Focus: Creative Industries, Entrepreneurship, Project Management, Company Development, Marketing, Coaching, Research Methods
Target group: You are creative and think entrepreneurially. You have already completed a Bachelor's degree in an artistically applied or a business-oriented course and would like to further expand your field of activity in one of the sub-markets of the creative industries. The BSP Master's programme in Creative Business Management broadly prepares you for market challenges, creative processes, new digital markets and innovative technologies and offers all the prerequisites for a successful career and career path.
Annotation: Interdisciplinary thinking and working are typical characteristics of the creative industries and are dealt with intensively in the Creative Business Management degree within the framework of all competence fields. Entrepreneurship in the creative industries today predominantly means recognising - digital - movements of change and developing new creative business models from them. A three-stage integrated practical project also enables students to set up their own company during their degree.
Admission requirements:
relevant professional qualification according to §10 of Berlin Higher Education Act (BerlHG)
    Completed Bachelor's degree in Economics or
  completed Bachelor's degree in Art or Aesthetics

Focus: Principles of Economics, Fashion marketing, Fashion Design, Fashion Management, Practical Projects
Annotation:
Fashion is creativity, individuality and dynamism, but behind even the most revealing brand and the funkiest creation there are sophisticated management and marketing processes without which fashion cannot function. For this reason, the Fashion Marketing degree course provides not only a broad knowledge of all facets of fashion, but also a sound understanding of the interrelationships between markets, corporate structures and target groups.
A plus of the course is the intensive promotion of communication and teamwork skills. In teaching and in practical projects, work is regularly done in teams, and ideas and strategies are repeatedly presented to real clients or within the study group.
The study of fashion marketing and Berlin as a creative location offers an ideal study and starting point for a successful career in the wide world of fashion. Whether you are working in retail, marketing, management or PR, you will find the right infrastructure and players in Berlin. The integrated project degree at home or abroad provide first insights into future professional fields. Cooperation with companies, partners in practice and lecturers from practice help to establish contacts for starting a career during the degree course and to enable a smooth transition from degree to career.
Admission requirements:
-Qualification for university studies under Section 10 Berlin Higher Education Act (general entrance qualification for higher education, subject-restricted entrance qualification for higher education, entrance qualification for higher education at universities of applied sciences or comparable qualification certificate) or
- University admission for professionally qualified persons according to Section 11 BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act)
-Possibility of further study in accordance with Section 11 BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act)

Focus: Marketing, Personnel Management, Financing, Business English, Organisation, Study projects
Annotation:
The world is open to you - the Bachelor of International Business Administration prepares you for a career in an international company. During your degree you will prove your international skills through the semester abroad and by working in an international company. Through the extended practical phases of the project degree, you will gain an early insight into everyday business life and work on practical business issues. As a graduate of the Bachelor's degree, you will be internationally mobile, have language skills for worldwide use and be able to deal with the challenges of a globalised economy.
Content
  In seven semesters you will be fit for a career in an international company. 
  A compulsory semester abroad is integrated into the degree.
  Practical projects and two foreign languages are included in the degree.
  Intercultural skills are intensely practised.
Admission requirements:
-Qualification for university studies under Section 10 Berlin Higher Education Act (general entrance qualification for higher education, subject-restricted entrance qualification for higher education, entrance qualification for higher education at universities of applied sciences or comparable qualification certificate) or
- University admission for professionally qualified persons according to Section 11 BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act) 
-Possibility of further study in accordance with Section 11 BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act)

Focus: Economic principles for psychologists, Psychological principles for economists and business administrators, Counselling psychology of business psychologists, Media Psychology, Media Management, Systematic counselling and reflection
Target group: Graduates of a completed Bachelor's degree in the field of Psychology, Media, Communication or Cultural Studies, Media Design courses or comparable professional qualifications.
Annotation:
The Master's in Media Psychology combines psychology, communication and media sciences with economics, management and marketing. whereby this is to be based on
In particular, the programme conveys the necessary media psychology theories and methods for the various fields of activity. By cooperating with partners from companies and media organisations, the teaching is backed by an intensive application and practical relevance that is close to the workplace.
The cultural, psychoanalytical and morphological focus of the Master's programme based on qualitative methods is unique throughout Germany. A cultural-psychological perspective describes and analyses media consistently in their everyday and unconscious activities. The Morphological Approach considers the use of media in particular as the formation of patterns in constant change.
Combined with the positions and perspectives of science-driven media psychology, you will acquire a broad range of skills to understand media and communication in their relevant contexts. You are able to develop effective concepts and measures, especially with regard to the design and efficient use of media.
Admission requirements:
The following admission requirements have to be fulfilled for commencement of a Master's degree course in Media Psychology pursuant to § 10 BbgHG:
Bachelor's degree in the field of Psychology, Media, Communication or Cultural Studies, Media Design studies or comparable relevant qualifications (higher education) - for foreign applicants a certificate of education acc. § 11 BerlHG
Area of study: Social Psychology / Media Studies

Course Name: Applied Geosciences – Applied Mineralogy and Crystallography (AMC)
Annotation:
Sport ist Leidenschaft und Emotion, aber auch Wettbewerb und Geschäft. Der internationale Sportmarkt ist mit einem Jahresumsatz von mehr als 80 Mrd. Euro einer der am stärksten wachsenden und größten Märkte weltweit. Komplexe Organisationsstrukturen und die fortschreitende Digitalisierung stellen die Branche vor enorme Herausforderungen und erfordern eine verstärkte Professionalisierung im Sport. Im Masterstudiengang Sports Management and Legal Skills setzen sich die Studierenden deshalb mit beiden Seiten des Sports auseinander. Der gewählte Studienschwerpunkt trägt dazu bei, eine berufsfeldbezogene Handlungskompetenz für eine Tätigkeit an der Schnittstelle von Ökonomie, Management und Sport zu erhalten.
Inhalte:
- In vier Semestern sind Sie fit für eine Tätigkeit als Führungskraft im Leistungssport
- Entwicklung einer starken Managerpersönlichkeit 
- Umfassende Handlungskompetenzen an der Schnittstelle von Ökonomie, Management, Recht und Sport
- Managementtätigkeit in Sportvereinen, Sportverbänden, Ligen
- Arbeitsvertragsgestaltung, Lizenzmodelle und Spielertransfer
- Marketing, Kommunikationsmanagement und Sponsoring
Admission requirements:
- einschlägiger berufsqualifizierender Hochschulabschluss gemäß § 10 V BerlHG
- Es wird ein mit Erfolg abgeschlossenes einschlägiges Bachelorstudium im sportwissenschaftlichen, sportpsychologischen, wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen, rechtswissenschaftlichen, managementbezogenen Bereich bzw. in einem sachverwandten Gebiet mit mindestens 180 ECTS-Punkte (European Credit Transfer System) gefordert.

Focus: Distribution and Communication of Luxury, Luxury Markets, Brand Management
Target group: The degree course in Branding and Luxury Goods Marketing prepares you to meet the demands of managing premium products on the global market for luxury goods.
Annotation:
As a personal university, accadis Hochschule Bad Homburg offers its approximately 600 students a familiar atmosphere with a steep learning curve in small, interactive lectures. Since the university has only one location (Bad Homburg), students can find all the important contacts for their studies on site. The degree course and examination organisation always helps students if any questions should arise. Lecturers are also happy to answer questions outside of lectures. accadis students are not matriculation numbers, but people with names and unique backgrounds. They also develop their strengths outside the lecture hall and build up a broad business network through practical projects, the accadis Career Day and the accadis Business Lounge. 
accadis graduates can start their careers on a solid academic basis and with a well-trained mind. They convince potential employers with analytical skills, social, rhetorical and digital competence. You work well in a team, present confidently and convincingly, and lead employees with strong people skills.
Internationality is a central element in every accadis degree course. Teaching by internationally experienced lecturers and guest lecturers from partner universities as well as fellow students from all over the world characterise everyday life at the accadis campus. The language of lectures in the Master's degree course is English without exception. A semester abroad is also planned in the full-time Master's degree programme and possible in the dual or part-time Master's degree programme, provided it is compatible with the employer.
The global market for premium products, from luxury perfume to high fashion and designer furniture to high-priced cars and multi-million dollar real estate, expects original marketing campaigns that raise industry standards to a new level. accadis students develop into experts for luxury goods and, as graduates in exciting positions, communicate the emotional benefits and special added value of luxury products to demanding target groups. During your degree course you will attend the core lectures Brand Management, Luxury Markets as well as Distribution and Communication of Luxury. In full-time studies, you will specialise your knowledge in an elective, e.g. Pricing Strategies. Multifaceted generalist modules such as Contemporary Internet Marketing, Risk Management or Applied Global Finance as well as lectures on leadership skills round off your studies.
Start-up 'n' Study - with Building Entrepreneurs!
You are bursting with ideas and want to get your own company off the ground. Then our new Building Entrepreneurs! programme is just right for you. Here the question is not: start a business or go to university first? You decide to found AND study. The programme "Building Entrepreneurs" can be combined with all accadis Bachelor and Master degree courses.
What makes the programme? 
Concepts instead of exams: The great innovation of the Building Entrepreneurs! programme is that you relate selected exam credits in your studies to your business idea.
Coaching: During the entire degree course, a business coach from the accadis Institute of Entrepreneurship will support you. As your contact and sparring partner, he supports you in developing your business idea.
accadis coworking space: Here you will find everything you need for starting up and studying. You work on your concept in peace, organise your meetings and conferences... and brainstorm with like-minded fellow students.
Admission requirements:
- Completed bachelor's degree in economics 
- Alternatively: Completed interdisciplinary Bachelor's degree with at least 90 ECTS in economics
- Good final grade in the first degree programme
– Good knowledge of English | Levels B2 or C1
- Successful introduction presentation

Focus: Big Data, Deep Learning, Data Mining
Annotation: Your distance learning is carried out in 4 semesters and is modularly structured. You choose your personal focus between the specialisations Big Data, Deep Learning, Data Mining and Data Management. They are intensively involved in the recognition, formulation and solution of complex data analysis problems, learn to handle digital media with confidence, acquire communication skills and the ability to work in a team. You are well prepared for taking on leadership responsibilities and have various learning strategies for lifelong learning. You develop strategies to integrate, analyse and structure heterogeneous data of a company and to present analysis results in a way that is understandable for experts.
Admission requirements: If you already have a university degree in Business Information Systems or Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Administration with a focus on Business Information Systems, Industrial Engineering and Management, Data Science or a comparable degree, our Master's degree programme is open to you.

Focus: Internet and Social Media Marketing, Capital-Market-Based Corporate Management, Digital Strategies and Business Models, External Corporate Communications
Annotation:
As a personal university, accadis Hochschule Bad Homburg offers its approximately 600 students a familiar atmosphere with a steep learning curve in small, interactive lectures. Since the university has only one location (Bad Homburg), students can find all the important contacts for their studies on site. The degree course and examination organisation always helps students if any questions should arise. Lecturers are also happy to answer questions outside of lectures. accadis students are not matriculation numbers, but people with names and unique backgrounds. They also develop their strengths outside the lecture hall and build up a broad business network through practical projects, the accadis Career Day and the accadis Business Lounge. 
accadis graduates can start their careers on a solid academic basis and with a well-trained mind. They convince potential employers with analytical skills, social, rhetorical and digital competence. You work well in a team, present confidently and convincingly, and lead employees with strong people skills.
Internationality is a central element in every accadis degree course. Teaching by internationally experienced lecturers as well as fellow students from all over the world characterise everyday life at the accadis campus. Instruction in Business English is just as much a part of the curriculum as internationally oriented lecture content. If it is compatible with your employer, you can also complete a semester or two lectures at one of our partner universities abroad during your part-time studies.
The Bachelor of International Business Management B.A course is uniquely academic and flexible. As an employee, you decide how your degree can be integrated into your everyday working life and whether you attend lectures online or on site. Your benefit: The average of eight hours of attendance per week is divided into lectures usually on Saturdays from 09:00 to 16:15 and partly on Thursdays from 18:15 to 19:45. This is how we guarantee the highest flexibility and plannability during the working week. With lecture content that is relevant in all sectors, you will have access to a wide range of career options.
Admission requirements:
- General or subject-restricted higher education or equivalent international qualification as well as completed commercial training (IHK)
You can also apply if 
- You have completed a particular course of further or continuing education. Feel free to contact us for details.
- You pass a university entrance examination after at least two years of vocational training and education and with two years of professional experience
Area of study: International Business Administration / Business Consultancy / Business Management, Organization Management

Focus: Product Development, Production, Supply Chain Management and Logistics, Technical Sales and Marketing
Annotation:
Would you like to combine expertise in Engineering with well-grounded knowledge of Business Administration? And thus be able to work in responsible positions at interfaces in all areas of a company? Then, the distance learning course in Industrial Engineering (B.Eng.) will be right for you. As an industrial engineer you will be in control of integrated management and sustainable solution expertise for inter-disciplinary tasks. As generalist experts, industrial engineers cross the borders of knowledge, able to respond to company requirements in a sustainable and innovative manner. You develop new methods and techniques and therefore need the most up-to-date expertise in various fields. Through this course, you will therefore also acquire business administration, foreign language and non-technical skills, as well as management skills and key personal skills. The degree in Industrial Engineering will certainly provide you with skills for scientific and practical work as well as cross-subject and cross-functional projects. Your degree thus qualifies you to work in a specialist or management position in middle management, regardless of the sector. We offer four interesting options as elective subjects: Product Development, Production, Supply Chain Management and Logistics or Technical Sales and Marketing.
A technical highlight of your distance learning course is practical laboratory work that is completed in cooperation with our renowned partner universities Pforzheim and Wedel. This guarantees that you will work with state-of-the-art laboratory equipment. And you will be able to enter into intensive dialogue with professors and lab engineers. We rely on state-of-the-art media, such as web-based training (WBT), to teach the curriculum. You will receive from us the study materials and valuable software free of charge (e.g. SIMULINK) for your personal use. 
By the way: as a student of this distance learning course, you will be able to participate in a three-week study session in Sacramento: through the California Campus Program.
Within the framework of the AKAD-study model, you decide yourself – depending on learning type, level of knowledge or interest – whether you participate in the additional seminars of your course of study at the AKAD University in Stuttgart or not.
Admission requirements: School-leaving certificate giving right of entry to higher education or entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences. If you do not have a school leaving certificate giving right of entry to higher education or an entrance qualification for studies at universities of applied sciences, you can still study under certain conditions.
Area of study: Engineering and Management / Business Administration

Target group:
Primarily, the course is aimed at teachers who are already professionally and pedagogically qualified and have a first qualifying Bachelor's degree, as well as at people who are already working in or interested in pedagogy, full-time and part-time employees in adult or continuing education, in-company continuing education, course and programme planning, and graduates of degree courses such as:

The course is also aimed at people with an equivalent degree from Germany or abroad. For this, the German language skills must correspond to at least the B2 level.

a first vocational qualification for a university degree in the amount of 180 ECTS* or 210 ECTS points with a share of at least 30 ECTS in educational modules.
* Applicants whose first degree comprises less than 210 ECTS points or applicants who can demonstrate less than 30 ECTS educational content are given the opportunity to obtain this through a proven pedagogical profession or practical activity in a credit transfer procedure or in seminars at the Akkon University. It is aimed at all those who want to actively and sustainably shape the digital transformation in companies or in public administration. Practice-relevant digital skills are taught in combination with innovative technologies and agile management methods. In addition to the fundamentals of digital transformation, specialisations are offered in the areas of data science, AI and robotics, and cyber security.
Annotation:
The degree course teaches sound scientific working methods for the digital networked world of tomorrow. It combines technology and management knowledge for fast and successful application in companies and public administrations. Students acquire the necessary skills to actively and sustainably shape the digital transformation.
•\tBlended learning as an innovative study design

Focus: Antike Geschichte, Geschichte der Vormoderne, Kultur/Geschichte: Politik - Bild - Kunst, Gesellschaft - Wissen - Umwelt, Global- und Verflechtungsgeschichte, Geschichtskulturen, Global Cultures
Annotation:
Forschungsorientierung und optimale Unterstützung in der wissenschaftlichen und beruflichen Qualifizierung für einen Berufsweg als Historikerin oder Historiker zeichnen das Masterstudium Geschichtswissenschaft an der Universität Bielefeld aus. Der fachwissenschaftliche Masterstudiengang Geschichtswissenschaft ermöglicht ein breitgefächertes und vertiefendes Studium zu vielen historischen Themen und aktuellen Forschungsfragen. Einen besonderen Stellenwert nehmen dabei die Vermittlung theoretischer und methodischer Kompetenzen sowie transnationale und vergleichende Perspektiven ein.
Der Masterstudiengang Geschichtswissenschaft deckt das Fach Geschichtswissenschaft in seiner ganzen Breite ab, ermöglicht aber zugleich auch eine Spezialisierung des Studiums durch die Wahl eines Profils, das als Studienschwerpunkt auf dem Zeugnis ausgewiesen wird. Profile werden für Forschungsschwerpunkte der Abteilung Geschichtswissenschaft angeboten. Derzeit bestehen Profile für folgende Bereiche:
    Antike Geschichte
    Geschichte der Vormoderne
    Kultur/Geschichte: Politik – Bild – Kunst
    Gesellschaft – Wissen – Umwelt
    Global- und Verflechtungsgeschichte
    Geschichtskulturen
    Global Cultures (in Kooperation mit der Universität Bologna, Angebot in englischer Sprache)
Die Universität Bielefeld gehört zu den international renommierten Standorten historischer Forschung. 'Bielefeld School' ist nicht nur ein Markenzeichen für moderne, theoriegeleitete historische Forschung, sondern vor allem ein Ort der lebendigen wissenschaftlichen Diskussion. Von Studierenden und Lehrenden gemeinsam organisierte Studiengruppen, wöchentliche Forschungskolloquien, die im Rahmen der Exzellenzinitiative geförderte Bielefeld Graduate School in History and Sociology, ein Sonderforschungsbereich sowie zahlreiche internationale Kooperationen mit Universitäten in Europa und Übersee schaffen ein inspirierendes und kooperatives Umfeld, in das Masterstudierende frühzeitig aktiv eingebunden werden.
Der Master of Arts Geschichtswissenschaft soll dabei nicht nur auf „klassische“ Berufsfelder von Historikerinnen und Historikern – Museum, Archiv, Universität –, sondern auch auf die Bereiche Medien, Öffentlichkeitsarbeit, Stiftungen, Bildung und Wissensmanagement in Unternehmen vorbereiten. Der Arbeitsbereich „Geschichte als Beruf“ bietet allen Masterstudierenden eine studienbegleitende, ausgiebige Beratung zu möglichen Berufsfeldern und vermittelt zudem Kontakte zu und Praktikumsplätze in entsprechenden Institutionen und Einrichtungen.
Admission requirements: Prerequisite is participation in an application procedure that determines who is admitted by reviewing the application documents. The application documents must be submitted to the Admissions Office of the University of Bielefeld by the deadline. You can find more detailed information on the website of the University of Bielefeld or the department-specific requirements published there.

Focus: Transportation Logistics, Logistics Networks and Global Logistics, Production and Production Logistics, Digitalisation in Logistics
Annotation: Just a few years ago, logistics was limited to transport from A to B. As a result of globalisation, the industry now faces complex challenges. For logistics managers, this opens up multiple possibilities, because qualified specialists are desperately sought. The course qualifies you for different management tasks. You are responsible for the correct organisation of the production channels and supply chains. You monitor the complex supply chain and analyse its processes. You adapt these on the basis of cost-optimising aspects. You plan transport routes in order to make them more efficient, faster and more profitable. Co-operation with new suppliers and customers is also one of your tasks. Your employers include large or medium-sized freight forwarders, industrial companies, airports, production companies, logistics service providers and retailers. As a dispatcher, key account manager, logistics manager or traffic manager, you work with different companies and suppliers nationally and internationally. By the way: as a student of this distance learning course, you will be able to participate in a three-week study session in Sacramento: the California Campus Program! Within the framework of the AKAD-study model, you decide yourself – depending on learning type, level of knowledge or interest – whether you participate in the additional seminars of your course of study at the AKAD University in Stuttgart or not.
Admission requirements: School-leaving certificate giving right of entry to higher education or entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences. If you do not have a school leaving certificate giving right of entry to higher education or an entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences, you can still study under certain conditions.
Area of study: Business Administration / Logistics, Transport, Transport Management

Focus: Service Design, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, Technical Sales and Marketing, Environmental Management
Annotation:
You are looking for a professionally qualifying degree course that gets you ready for your career at a service-oriented company at the interface between technical and Business Administration tasks? With this inter-disciplinary and value-oriented course, you will receive practice-related management training with a Business Administration and technical background, which will open up excellent prospects to you. 
Companies with a service character are looking for managers who can operate comfortably at the interface between technical and Business Administration processes. As a qualified Technical Business Administrator with a service orientation, you will be able to competently handle both the commercial tasks of the company and also the technical demands. In the industrial sector in particular - as well as in the international environment - you will be able to put your expertise into practice successfully. In this distance-learning degree course, you will acquire the knowledge and skills that you need to successfully improve the competitiveness of service companies in intensively competitive markets, which are characterised by constant innovations and new technical developments. 
The distance-learning course Technical Business Administration and Services - Bachelor of Science consists of six consecutive semesters. The sixth semester offers you numerous options for technical specialisation. You can choose between Service Design, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, Technical Sales and Environmental Management. 
By the way: as an AKAD student, you will be able to participate in a three-week study session in Sacramento: through the California Campus Program.
Within the framework of the AKAD-study model, you decide yourself - depending on learning type, level of knowledge or interest - whether you participate in the additional seminars of your course of study at the AKAD University in Stuttgart or not.
Admission requirements: School-leaving certificate giving right of entry to higher education or entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences. Study without a school leaving certificate giving right of entry to higher education is possible.
Area of study: Business Administration / Logistics, Transport, Transport Management / Environmental Management, Energy Management

Focus: Qualitative Methods, Principles of Economics, Principles of Management, Business Psychology, Cultural Psychology
Annotation:
Business Psychology imparts scientific findings in to economic tasks in a broad application spectrum, combining classical entrepreneurial approaches with psychological competences and business psychology expertise. 
In the Bachelor’s course in Business Psychology students therefore are initially introduced to the foundations of Business Administration and National Economics and also gain an insight into Management Studies. The special feature of this course is a combination of five interesting fields of application that is unique in Germany:
Market and consumer psychology
Media Psychology
Cross-Cultural Psychology 
Organisational Psychology
Personnel Psychology
A further characteristic is the culture psychology focus over the course of studies: With solid foundations from the field of Cultural Psychology, students are prepared to understand the way in which brands, media and companies function in the respectively relevant contexts of day-to-day life and culture as well as to develop effective measures and efficient concepts.
The continual training in quantitative and qualitative research methods enables students to specialise already during their studies, e.g. in the area of quantitative Personnel or Market Psychology or in qualitative, psychoanalysis-oriented Organisational Psychology or Media Research. The systematic training of students’ social and personal skills is also firmly integrated into the course profile. 
Upon completion of the course students are qualified to analyse and effectively structure organisational and communication processes against the background of psychological contexts. The application fields offered enable students to specialise at an early stage in the areas of market research, media, communication and marketing, human resources or employment and organisational development.
The special aspects of the Bachelor's degree course in Business Psychology at the Business School Potsdam are
- the training in quantitative and qualitative methods on the basis of the (business) psychology theories and concepts underlying these methods
- the teaching of Business Psychology from a cultural psychology-in-depth psychology perspective that is unique in Germany with 
-a combination of five practice-based application fields with optimum career prospects
The Business Psychology course is also offered at the BSP Campus Hamburg. Further details are available at: www.bsp-campus-hamburg.de
Admission requirements: General, subject-restricted higher education entrance qualification or higher education entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences in accordance with Section 10 of the law governing higher education in Berlin (BerlHG) or special entrance for working professionals with entrance examination in accordance with Section 11 of the law governing higher education in Berlin (BerlHG) (consistent with the entrance examination regulations of the university)
Area of study: Vocational Pedagogy / Sociology, Social Science

_University Name: Hochschule Fresenius - University of Applied Sciences
Focus: Economic principles for psychologists, Psychological principles for economists and business administrators, Counselling psychology of business psychologists, Personnel Development, Organisational Development, Systematic counselling and reflection
Target group: Graduates of Psychological or Business Bachelor's degree courses with an interest in development work with personalities in companies as well as Business Psychologists with a specialisation in coaching and counselling.
Annotation:
Economic laws alone no longer guarantee the long-term success of a company. Employee satisfaction and life-work balance play an important role here. Personnel and organisation managers of tomorrow therefore have to know business management as well have psychological and communicative skills.
The MasterŽs in Business Psychology prepares students for practical fields of personnel and organisational development in companies and institutions and is aimed at graduates of Bachelor programmes in Psychology or Business Administration.
In order to ensure an optimal entry into the MasterŽs programme in Business Psychology, the (elective) modules of the first semester are individually tailored to the students previous knowledge. Depending on the knowledge acquired in the BachelorŽs programme, the main subjects of the first-semester students are in the areas of business, psychological or economic-psychological competences.
In terms of content, the Master's degree course focuses on the psychological aspects of HR management. This involves the leadership and advising of employees, teams and institutions. In-depth research, support and advice on change processes in companies is a major task here. The cultural-psychological specialisation in morphological consulting is unique in Germany. It is complemented by systemic, reflexive and social-communicative skills.
Admission requirements: Relevant university degree according to § 10 BerlHG - Completed Bachelor's or Bachelor's degree with specialisation in Business Administration and practical experience in the area of personnel / organisation - Proof of educational qualifications according to § 11 BerlHG

_University Name: ESMT European School of Management and Technology
Focus: Migration and Integration
Annotation:
Migration and integration are future issues that change our society. These changes lead to migration- and integration-specific tasks in politics, business, administration and in the health/social sector. 
From a broad foundation in social sciences, the course teaches the necessary skills to perform such tasks in a responsible and qualified manner. Sociology, education, psychology, political science, law, economic or cultural sciences are examples of social science disciplines that make up the perspective from which the topics of migration and integration will be analysed during the course. 
The acquisition of language skills and practical experience in Germany and abroad are further central components of the course. The course includes a compulsory year abroad, which can be completed at a partner university or practising institutions. Classes are taught in German and English. A further foreign language is learnt during the course.
Admission requirements: Command of English and German (for migrants) at B2 level. Provisional admission is possible with language skills at B1 level.

Focus: Education and Teaching, Health Aid and Rehabilitation, Social Administrative Help and Planning, Socialisation and Re-socialisation, Migration and Integration, Media Education
Annotation: Ausführliche Informationen zu den Studiengängen der Katholischen Hochschule Mainz sowie alles Wichtige zu den Themen Studienorientierung und Bewerbung findest du auf unserer Seite für Studieninteressierte: www.studierenwashilft.kh-mz.de
Admission requirements:
Admission requirement is the general or subject-specific higher education entrance qualification or entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences or vocational training including at least two years of work experience or a further vocational qualification through a master craftsman's examination or a comparable examination, e.g. at a technical college.
If the applicant has no corresponding relevant practical training, a pre-study internship of 12 weeks is also a prerequisite for admission.
Area of study: Social Work / Sociology, Social Science

_University Name: SRH Berlin University of Applied Sciences
Focus: Consultation and Case Management, Social Work
Target group:
For admission, students must have successfully completed a
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant subject. The Bachelor’s degree course in Social Work at the KH Mainz covers 210 credit points (seven semesters). Admission is nevertheless possible for students who have completed a six-semester Bachelor's degree course
or a Bachelor's degree course worth 180 credit points. In this case, students must show that they have recognisable achievements worth 30 credit points after admission or make up for them during the Master's degree course. Membership of the Catholic church is not a prerequisite for admission.

Admission requirements: completed subject-specific degree
Area of study: Social Work / Guidance

Course Name: Executive MBA in Innovation & Business Creation (MBA)
Annotation:
With the degree programme Applied Nursing Science B.Sc., the katho offers a study programme with a clinical orientation which complements the skills acquired in vocational training and education and leads to an extended science-based nursing expertise.
In addition to full-time studies, it is also possible to study part-time in the form of contact studies during vocational training. This means that during the apprenticeship, students study alongside their apprenticeship and then enter the 4th semester of full-time studies.
Admission requirements:
Completed education in a health and nursing profession / midwife and one year relevant work experience after the nursing exam.
You will also be admitted without an entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences if you have three years of relevant professional experience.
An entry into the study process is also possible after the first year of training in the form of a contact course of studies in cooperation with the training provider. An entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences is necessary

Focus: Pastoral Service, Religious Education in Schools, Church-religious education
Annotation:
The course of Studies of Applied Theology (religious education studies) is characterised by a scientific and practice-oriented orientation. It imparts both theological and humane knowledge and skills that enable students to do so,
- to understand the Christian faith more deeply and to communicate it responsibly,
- to help people in different personal situations and circumstances to lead a meaningful life,
- to independently carry out pastoral or religious education tasks assigned to them.
Admission requirements: A subject relevant work placement (8 weeks) in parishes or associations, in the field of extracurricular educational work as well as in educational, social or charitable institutions (at least four weeks of which should take place in a parish). Periods of relevant vocational training, relevant activities within the framework of the training of grade 11 of the specialised upper secondary school or relevant activities within the framework of the acquisition of the annual work placement serving as an access entitlement may be credited in whole or in part to this basic work placement.

Target group: Graduates of Medicine, Psychology, Social Work
Annotation: The degree programme qualifies students in five semesters to work in addiction therapy (DRV-recognised) on the basis of a current scientific, practice-oriented curriculum. Since 2007, the degree programme has also been offered at the  Katholische Stiftungsfachhochschule (KSFH) in Munich.
Admission requirements: A general (or subject-related) higher education entrance qualification (or an entrance qualification recognised as equivalent by the competent state authorities), a degree in human sciences, and work in the field of addiction aid (or a related field)

Course Name: FAME+ Master of Science in Functional Advanced Materials and Engineering
Focus: Wissenschaftliches Denken, Arbeiten und Forschen, Kindheitspädagogik als Wissenschaft und Profession, Normative Grundlagen und gesellschaftliche Rahmenbedingungen, Grundlagen menschlicher Existenz und Entwicklung, Handlungsfelder der Kindheitspädagogik
Annotation: The full-time, training-integrated degree course "Childhood Education B.A." systematically interlinks vocational training to become a state-approved educator with a Bachelor's course of study in childhood education from the first semester on. The programme represents a network between the Catholic University of Applied Sciences NRW (Cologne department), five cooperating schools for social education (four Catholic and one state) and cooperating practical placement providers and their institutions. Students thereby acquire theoretical knowledge as well as professional action and research skills for all childhood pedagogical fields of activity.
Admission requirements: Proof of a school contract at a cooperating vocational school for special education.

_University Name: SRH Berlin University of Applied Sciences
Focus: Wissenschaftliches Denken und Arbeiten, Kindheitspädagogik als Wissenschaft und Profession, Normative Grundlagen und gesellschaftliche Rahmenbedingungen, Grundlagen menschlicher Existenz und Entwicklung, Handlungsfelder der Kindheitspädagogik
Annotation: The aim of the Bachelor's course of studies in childhood education is to enable students to act professionally in fields of activity in childhood education through practice-oriented teaching on a scientific basis.
Admission requirements:
Pre-study work placement (3 months) in the field of childhood education. 
The pre-study work placement is deemed to have been completed when you have acquired the qualification for the degree course by means of the certificate of entrance qualification for studies at a technical school for healthcare and social work. The fulfilment of the required pre-study work placement must be credibly assured by the application deadline. The actual completion of the programme is possible until the beginning of the semester (September 1st).

Annotation: In the Master's degree programme in Cooperation Management, students learn about multi-professional forms of cooperation and their implementation in health and social management. They deal with leadership and management concepts, develop networking skills and practice project management. The course of studies enable students to integrate economic and ethical skills into the concepts of health and social services and provides basic knowledge for subsequent research projects.
Admission requirements: A university degree qualifying for a profession in the fields of social work, social education, curative education, nursing science (nursing education, nursing management), theology, religious education, business administration, teaching profession at schools or in other relevant, related fields of human sciences (e.g. psychology, medicine or similar) and at the start of the course of study has relevant professional experience of at least one year and is active to an appropriate extent in fields of social and health services parallel to the course of study.
Area of study: Health Management / Economic Sciences, Economics

Target group: Specialists and managers in social work, health and care facilities, counselling centres, cities and communities. Education and pastoral workers. The course of study can also serve as preparation for a career as a diversity manager.
Annotation: Cooperative study course of the Katholischen Hochschule Nordrhein-Westfalen, the Philosophisch-Theologische Hochschule SVD St. Augustin and the Diözesan-Caritasverbandes für das Erzbistum Köln\ \; Enrolment is at the Katholischen Hochschule Nordrhein-Westfalen. The Master's level qualification is also awarded by the Katholische Hochschule Nordrhein-Westfalen. The courses are mainly held at the Philosophisch-Theologische Hochschule SVD St. Augustin.
Admission requirements: Diplom, Bachelor's or comparable degree in a subject from the Human Sciences, Social Sciences or Humanities and at least one year of relevant professional experience.
Area of study: Sociology, Social Science / Religious Studies

University's Official emails: international@katho-nrw.de / ausland.aachen@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.muenster@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.aachen@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.paderborn@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.koeln@katho-nrw.de / Köln: t.hoff@katho-nrw.de; Paderborn: e.juenemann@katho-nrw.de; Münster: y.brandl@katho-nrw.de; Aachen: r.krockauer@katho-nrw.de
Annotation:
The Master's degree programme with integrated advanced education is run by the (arch-)bishoprics of Freiburg, Hildesheim, Cologne, Münster and Paderborn and has an overarching orientation towards schools of counselling and therapy. At the various study locations, different focal points are set for in-depth studies. 
The degree programme also provides sociological, legal and theological framework conditions for counselling. The reflection of a spiritual counselling attitude from the perspective of the Christian conception of man is of particular importance.
Admission requirements: A first degree qualifying for admission to a profession in psychology, social work, social pedagogy, education, theology, medicine, law or an equivalent course of study and at least one year's relevant professional experience

Course Name: Financial Engineering (MSc, Executive) at the HECTOR School
Admission requirements: Completed training as a midwife/nurse and valid authorisation to use the professional title

Target group: Heads of Nursing Education Institutions
Annotation:
With the degree programme Nursing Management M.A., the KatHO NRW offers a study programme which is aimed at interested graduates of the Bachelor's degree programme Nursing Science/Nursing Management.
This degree programme is designed to enable graduates to take on management tasks at the level of nursing services, nursing management or facility management (management). A special profile characteristic is the qualification of students to make decisions in contradictory activity situations based on an integrative and multidimensional understanding of science.
Admission requirements: Completed training in a nursing profession (geriatric nursing / health and nursing care / health and paediatric nursing) or as a midwife / delivery nurse, permission to use the professional title and an academic qualification through a relevant bachelor's or diploma study with the corresponding focus on nursing management or Diplom-Pflegewirt (nursing management)

Focus: Nursing Care Management, Nursing Care Education
Annotation: With the course of study Nursing Management B.Sc., the KatHO NRW offers a course of study programme which is aimed at trained nurses and midwives who have different professional experiences. The contents of the course of studies provide a basic qualification for taking on lower or middle management functions (ward management, residential area management, management of outpatient nursing services, departmental management). In addition, the student qualifies for tasks in project management and quality management in the field of nursing care.
Admission requirements: Completed nursing or midwifery training with a valid licence to practise the profession

Annotation: With the degree programme Nursing Education M.A., the KatHO NRW offers a study programme which is aimed at interested graduates of the Bachelor's degree programme Nursing Education. The course contents should enable them to work full-time as teachers at nursing education institutions.
Admission requirements: Completed training in a nursing profession (geriatric nursing / health and nursing care / health and paediatric nursing) or as a midwife / delivery nurse, permission to use the professional title and an academic qualification through a relevant bachelor's or diploma study with the corresponding focus
Area of study: Nursing Pedagogy / Health Care (Teaching Degree)

Focus: Nursing Care Management, Nursing Care Education
Annotation: With the degree programme Nursing Education B.Sc., the KatHO NRW offers a study programme aimed at trained nurses and midwives who wish to obtain academic qualifications in the field of institutionalised teaching-learning processes at schools of the health care system in a study programme specially tailored to their needs. The course contents should enable them to work in the fields of teaching, practical instruction and practical support on a scientifically sound basis.
Admission requirements: Completed nursing or midwifery training with a valid licence to practise the profession

Annotation:
The postgraduate continuing education programme School Management, M.A. imparts skills for the specific management tasks required for the management of care training institutions. 
Admission to the course of study takes place every two years in the winter semester (2017, 2019 etc.).
Admission requirements: Completed diploma or bachelor's/master's degree in the field of nursing education or comparable degree

Target group: Graduates in social education, special education studies and social work
Annotation:
Due to the structural changes in the social sector and social policy, the demands on employees, especially managers, have changed fundamentally. The Catholic University of Applied Sciences NRW reacts to this development: The postgraduate Master's degree programme in Social Management qualifies you for the complex tasks of leadership and management of social organisations at the carrier level and at the level of social services and institutions.
The degree programme begins every two years in the summer semester in March of an even year.
Admission requirements:
The programme can be taken up by anyone who
- holds a (subject) university degree (Bachelor or Diplom) at a university in the fields of social work (special education, social work), curative education, religious education\;
- at the start of their studies, they can generally provide evidence of at least three years' postgraduate practice in social work, and
- is in a managerial position or aspires to such a position. 
In addition, admission to course of studies can be granted to those who have a different university degree and
- at the start of their studies, they can generally provide evidence of at least three years' postgraduate practice in social work, and
- Is in a managerial position or aspires to such a position.

Focus: Bildung und Teilhabe, Klinische-therapeutische Soziale Arbeit, Innovationsmanagement in der Sozialen Arbeit, Netzwerkmanagement in der Sozialen Arbeit, Gesundheitsbezogene Soziale Arbeit
Annotation:

Education and Participation (Aachen)

Health-related Social Work (Paderborn)
  Participation-Oriented Networks in Curative Education, M.A. (Münster)
Admission requirements: Completed studies (Dipl., B.A., M.A.) in social work/curative education or a similar field of study (or, in the case of current enrolment, proof of previous achievements), good overall grade point average and willingness to do academic work

University's Official emails: international@katho-nrw.de / ausland.aachen@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.muenster@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.aachen@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.paderborn@katho-nrw.de / studienbuero.koeln@katho-nrw.de
Focus: Support for Children, Youths, Families and the Elderly, Social Services, Clinical Social Work, Social Psychiatry, Rehabilitation and Special Education Studies, General Industrial Social Work, Intercultural and International Social Work, Systemic Resource-Orientated Social Work, Cooperation Youth Welfare/Youth Work/School Social Work, Evaluation/Quality Assurance in Social Work, Education, Leisure and Cultural Work
Annotation:
On the one hand, the degree programme in Social Work imparts scientifically sound knowledge and action competences from social work and related sciences such as sociology, law, psychology, etc. on the other hand, the programme promotes competences to be able to act responsibly and professionally in relation to social problems and in concrete social contexts. 
Applications directly to the departments/campuses\; special study organisation in Aachen (compact study programme for women and men in addition to family work)
Admission requirements:
Pre-study work placement (3 months) in the field of social work, social education or special needs education. 
The pre-study work placement is deemed to have been completed when you have acquired the qualification for the course of study by means of the certificate of entrance qualification for studies at a technical school for social work/special education. The fulfilment of the required pre-study work placement must be credibly assured by the application deadline. The actual completion of the programme is possible until the beginning of the semester (September 1st).

Course Name: Full-Time MBA in Digitalisation & Industrial Change
Target group: Social work, public health service
Annotation: The degree programme is located at the Department of Social Services of the Münster Department of the Catholic University of Applied Sciences and is run in franchise cooperation with the Diocese of Münster. The course of studies begins every two years (even number years) in the winter semester.
Admission requirements: Completed degree (Diplom, Bachelor, Master)\; at least three years of professional experience\; Participation in at least 30 sessions of supervision/coaching in two different forms of supervision or coaching with supervisors / coaches at least partially recognised by the DGSv\; Proof of methodological knowledge through additional training or further training events which deal with the person - role - target group - organisation in a minimum of 400 teaching hours (a crediting of counselling relevant courses from an already completed Master's programme is possible upon written application to the programme director. Appropriate evidence must be provided)

Focus: Participation-Oriented Networks in Special Education
Annotation:
In the Master's degree programme Participatory Networks in Curative Education, you acquire
- in-depth knowledge of social, ethical and legal foundations for the further development of organisations and aid systems, 
- methodological knowledge for the initiation, coordination and design of networks promoting participation and inclusion, 
- research-methodological competence in order to record the living worlds of people in need of support and the potential for their change in a differentiated way.
Admission requirements: Completed studies (Dipl., B.A., M.A.) in social work/curative education or a similar field of study (or, in the case of current enrolment, proof of previous achievements), good overall grade point average and willingness to do academic work

Course Name: Game Development and Research (Master of Arts)
Focus: Disabled assistance, Educational Support
Admission requirements: Pre-course internship (at least 3 months) in a curative education or therapeutic pedagogy relevant field of practice

Focus: Hybrid Technologies, Printed Functionalities, Work Design and Sustainability Management, Production Systems
Admission requirements:
1. special mathematical methods of engineering totalling at least 18 LP, including the topics of Fourier transforms, regression calculation and probability and mathematical statistics,
2. scientific and engineering data processing totalling at least 12 LP, including the topics CAD, CAS, numerical simulation and data acquisition as well as multiphysics simulation including practical experience,
3. Metrology and Control Technology totalling at least 8 CP, in which the topics of sensors, actuators and digital methods of production are included
4., New substances and materials for engineering totalling at least 8 LP, including the topics of polymers, metals, composites, matrix systems and functional properties.
5. in-depth theoretical fundamentals of Engineering with a total of at least 12 credits, including the subjects of Engineering Mechanics, Design, Manufacturing and Fluid Dynamics,
6. Resource-efficient manufacturing concepts totalling at least 8 CP, including the topics of technical and natural cycles and networks, system optimisation and energy concepts
Area of study: Mechanical Engineering / Physics

_University Name: SRH Berlin University of Applied Sciences
Focus: Business Administration (Business Administration, Economics, Law), Social Skills, Business Informatics, Creation, Event Engineering, Trade Fair Construction, Web 2.0: virtual Event and Trade Fair Appearances, Trade Fair Management, Trade Fair Market and Event Market, Participant Management, Visitor Management
Annotation:
The career-integrated advanced training course in Event and Trade Fair Management (Bachelor) is set up at the Chemnitz University of Technology Centre for Knowledge and Technology Transfer (ZWT). It is realised in cooperation with the TUCed –An-Institut für Transfer und Weiterbildung GmbH (TUCed) This collaboration enables the range of courses to be tailored to the needs of professionals. The teaching content is taught at TUCed. The exams are carried out under the responsibility of the ZWT and the degree is awarded by the Chemnitz University of Technology.
The standard period of study is 8 semesters, the study programme is offered within 6 semesters, whereby the 6th semester is intended for the preparation of the Bachelor thesis. Depending on previous education and study intensity, a degree can therefore be obtained before the end of the standard period of study.
The 7th and 8th semester can be used to complete the study programme, extensive recognition options for relevant initial training with business / commercial relevance, for example from the areas of media, marketing / communication, events, tourism, trade
distance learning career-integrated with e-learning and self-study sections, face-to-face training phases and excursions with a high degree of practical connectivity (current job or employment contract not required).
Seminars on campus: approx. 20 attendance phases during the first five semesters, 2-4 attendance phases per semester (Thursday / Friday / Saturday), in the sixth semester Bachelor thesis
Study locations are Chemnitz, Chemnitz and Düsseldorf. Exams can also be taken in Munich.
State-recognised degree from the Chemnitz University of Technology
Annekatrin Baßler, M.Sc.
Student advisory service for the Bachelor's course in Event and Trade Fair Management
Reichenhainer Str. 29
09126 Chemnitz
annekatrin.bassler@tuced.tu-chemnitz.de
0371 909 49 38
Admission requirements:
General higher education entrance qualification, or relevant subject-restricted higher education entrance qualification, or a subject-related Master craftsman examination or a qualification for admission to higher education recognised as equivalent by legislation.
Applications for a study place are possible until the maximum number of participants (25 participants) and no later than two weeks before the start of the study.
Area of study: Digital Media / Sport, Event, Culture Management / Economic Sciences, Economics

Course Name: International Management and Intercultural Communication (GlobalMBA, Master of Arts)
Focus: Programming, Algorithms and Data Structures, Software Engineering, Database Systems, Data management systems
Annotation:
With our Computer Science (B.Sc.) degree course, students will
make a specialist in general informatics and a knowledge carrier
for information processing in industry and science.
Their core competence includes both practical
Computer science - this includes programming, algorithms and
data structures, software engineering, database systems as well as
data management systems - as well as theoretical computer science.
Theoretical knowledge is combined with practical
application knowledge to an attractive profile in IT systems,
software and its creation. You
keep abreast of the latest technical developments in computer science
and are able to drive forward their further development, and have the
interface competences to business administration and engineering sciences.
Set personal career impulses with this distance learning
as a future IT specialist!
Admission requirements:
In order to be able to take the degree course Computer Science (B.Sc.), you require
a general higher education entrance qualification, a subject-specific
higher education entrance qualification or the entrance qualification for a university of applied sciences (or a comparable
higher education entrance qualification according to the state university law of
Baden-Wuerttemberg). Thus, technical college degrees also entitle the holder
or HWK and IHK further training qualifications in
combination with a counselling interview on a degree course.

Focus: Waldorf Pedagogy, Practical research in educational, social and therapeutic professional fields
Target group:
Target group
1. University graduates who have studied a subject relevant to teaching 
2. People already working in the fields of education, therapy, social work or related professions
3. Graduates of a vocational training course or training seminar (e.g. Waldorf Education) in one of the above-mentioned professional fields
Annotation:
The Master's degree programme can be completed with either the Master of Arts, (M.A.) or Master of Education (M.Ed.).
The main focus of the programme is the acquisition of basic scientific methods and the gradual development and implementation of research projects. In addition to the development of traditional approaches in Education Science, there is also a particular focus on the theories and methods of reform and Waldorf pedagogy and their critical reflection. 
This degree programme qualifies students for professional activities in the management, counselling, evaluation and responsible further development of educational institutions and programmes, in quality management, but also for lecturing activities.
Course-specific contact:

Admission requirements:
Requirement for admission is a completed university degree (Bachelor's, Diplom or Magister degree, state examination).
Candidates who wish to become subject or upper secondary school teachers must have completed at least one course of study in a subject relevant to teaching
Candidates who choose to specialise in educational practice research should work in a pedagogical professional field (school, kindergarten, social institutions, youth welfare, etc.).
Area of study: Educational Research / Pedagogy, Educational Science / School Pedagogy / Educational Sciences

Der Nachweis für die deutsche Sprache ist entbehrlich für Bewerberinnen und Bewerber, deren Muttersprache Deutsch ist (Deutschland, Österreich, Schweiz). 
1. TestDaF 4 x 3
2. DSH 1
3. Goethe-Zertifikat B2
4. TELC B2
Der Nachweis über Englischkenntnisse ist entbehrlich für Bewerberinnen und Bewerber deren Muttersprache Englisch ist (u. a. USA, Großbritannien, Kanada, Irland, Malta,  Australien, Neuseeland, Südafrika). 
1. Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL®, iBT) mit einem Ergebnis von mindestens 72 Punkten
2. International English Language Testing System (IELTS Academic) mit einem Ergebnis von 5.5
3. Cambridge First Certificate in English (FCE) Grade C
4. telc English B2⋅ University
5. UNIcert® II
Area of study: Mining / Power Engineering

Course Name: Master of Science (MSc) in International Business Studies (MIBS)
Target group: As a humanities subject, Jewish Studies involves reflection on the basic cultural principles of society on a large as well as on a small scale. The aim of a humanities scholar is mainly to understand, to explain and finally to mediate: between groups, individuals and society. These processes require a precise methodical foundation and progressive critical observation with competence in the basic principles, a sense for detail and a view of the whole issue in its individuality and in context. As a European centre of competence in this area, the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien (HfJS) offers opportunities for in-depth study and comprehension not available elsewhere, and is therefore particularly attractive for students wishing to gain a Master in Jewish Studies.
Admission requirements: Admission requirements for the major field of study are the Allgemeine Hochschulreife (general university entrance qualification) or a comparable degree, as well as a completed bachelor's degree in Jewish Studies with a subject content of at least 50% or in courses of study with essentially the same content, and proof of the Hebraicum. In the main subject 100 credit points are completed at the HfJS and 20 credit points in the accompanying subject at the University of Heidelberg. Further details are regulated by the admission regulations and the examination regulations for the M.A. degree in Jewish Studies. A consecutive Master's degree course with restricted admissions. An application is required before enrolment can be applied for.

Admission requirements for degree courses in the accompanying subject are the General higher education entrance qualification or a comparable degree, as well as a completed Bachelor's degree in a humanities, cultural or social science degree course, including theology or law, or in Jewish Studies. In the accompanying subject 20 credit points are completed at the HfJS and 100 credit points in the main subject at the University of Heidelberg. Please also note the admission statutes and the examination regulations. Applications for the main subject takes place via the Heidelberg University. With the letter of admission from Heidelberg University for the main subject, an application for enrolment in the accompanying subject can be made at the HfJS.

Target group: The international non-consecutive joint Master's course in Jewish Studies/History of Jewish Cultures is primarily aimed at students who have not been awarded a Bachelor's degree in Jewish Studies, but in a Cultural, Humanities, Social Science or Theological discipline. It is designed as a Humanities and Cultural Studies programme, which deals with the varied forms and change of Jewish living environments throughout history and in the present. In order to be able to capture the complexity of the topic of study appropriately, the course of study is organised on an inter-disciplinary basis. The following disciplines and subjects are accordingly involved, amongst others: Jewish Studies, History, Theology, Religious Studies, Literary Studies, Philosophy, Gender Studies, Art History and Musicology.
Admission requirements: Bachelor's degree in a cultural, social sciences, humanities or theological discipline (e.g. Jewish Studies, History, German Language and Literature, other literature studies, Theology, Philosophy, Religious Studies, Islamic Studies, Cultural Studies, Gender Studies, Art History or Social Science). Please also note the admission regulations.

Course Name: Master of Science Ecology, Evolution, and Conservation (EEC)
Master of Science Evolution, Ecology and Systematics
Master of Science in Advanced Materials
Annotation:
Master programme of the University for Jewish Studies Heidelberg and of Padeia The European Institute for Jewish Studies in Sweden: The first stage of the course usually takes place in Stockholm. Applications for this one-year programme can be submitted until the 15 April of each year for the following winter semester.
The consecutive Master's aims to educate students in the cultural development of Jewish civilisations through language and source studies. Jewish life is not restricted to religious rites, but also includes all areas of human existence. Correspondingly, the Hochschule für Jüdische Studien offers several sub-areas, starting with the history of the Jewish people, to the Bible and Talmud, Philosophy, Literature and Linguistics right up to Jewish Art.

Target group: Bachelor's graduates with at least 1 year of professional experience
Annotation:
In the Master of Human Resource Management and Business Psychology, you will focus from the very beginning on either human resource or business and organizational psychology issues.
Depending on your personal orientation, you will study different aspects of human resource management, process and organizational design, and organizational psychology. You will learn value-adding and agility-enhancing HR instruments as well as management tools for HRM and organization. The legal framework for HR activities is also part of the curriculum - as is successful employee management through modern leadership approaches and the digital transformation in organizations. The current developments of New Work, Big Data Analytics, etc. are also part of the course, as are, for example, modern approaches to motivational psychology.
Admission requirements:
The DHBW CAS Master's programme is postgraduate and career-integrated. The following admission requirements must be met to commence studies:
- Successfully completed Bachelor's degree.
- After completing your bachelor's degree, you have worked and gained experience of at least one year in a job suitable for your desired degree program.
- At work you can implement the knowledge acquired in the Master's programme. 
- Your employer is informed about your application for the Master's program.

The artistic talent is determined in the aptitude test.

Course Name: Master of Science in Cognitive Systems
Focus: Playing Instruments, Conducting, Composing, Sound Direction
Target group: In the area of Contemporary Music, specialist training for musicians.
Admission requirements:
Admission to the master’s degree requires a completed university degree from a college of music or a comparable institution of higher education in or outside Germany with an instrumental main subject (Bachelor’s, Diploma, Church Music Examination or State Examination for Teaching Qualification in Music) or a comparable degree.
Sufficient English or German language skills are required for admission to this Master's degree. If English or German are not native languages, proof must be provided in the form of one of the following language certificates:
German language skills: 
a) TestDaF level 3 or 
b) Certificate B1 (CEFR) or 
c) DSH examination, level I or 
d) German Language Diploma of the KMK, 1. step:
English language skills: 
a) Certificate B1 
b) IELTS exam 3.5-4.5 
c) Cambridge exam: PET 
(d) TOEIC:
- Listening 275-399 
- Reading 275-384 
- Speaking 120-159 
- Writing 120-149 
e) TOEFL iBT: 57
f) UNICERT: I 
All students are strongly advised to acquire at least a basic command of German, as information material, e-mails and similar texts are predominantly written in German.

Course Name: Master of Science in Communication and Media Engineering (CME)
Admission requirements:
- Sufficient comand of the German language is required for admission to the course (TestDaF level 3, Zertifikat B1 (CEFR), DSH examination level 1 or German Language Diploma of the KMK 1. step).
- A prerequisite for admission to the qualifying examination is normally previous participation in international competitions, master classes or chamber music projects organised by or associated with the Kronberg Academy.
- Admission to the BA phase of the degree course requires successful completion of an aptitude test in accordance with Art. 3.

Course Name: Master of Science in Communications and Signal Processing
Admission requirements:
A prerequisite for admission to the qualifying examination is normally previous participation in international competitions, master classes or chamber music projects organized by or associated with the Kronberg Academy.
  Admission to the MA phase of the degree course requires the successful completion of the BA phase of the degree course or the passing of an aptitude test according to § 3 (in this case, the degree of difficulty of the aptitude test is based on the requirements of the final examinations of the BA phase)

Annotation:
The course of study Musical Practice leading to the degree of MASTER OF MUSIC is available with the following different variations:
- for instrumental music
- for church music (compare with ChMu degree)
- for singing
- for chamber music
- for coaching musicians
- for composition
- for music theory
- for music education
- as Elite Opera Studio (2 semesters)
With the exception of the Elite Opera Studio, the courses of study lasts four semesters.
For the Music Education variation, you must already decide on one of the following profiles when submitting your application:
- Teaching Instrumental Music/Singing
- Music Theory/Aural Training
- Popular Music
Admission requirements: completed Bachelor or Diplom degree course as well as passing the aptitude test of the music college
Area of study: Singing, Speaking / Instrumental Music

_University Name: NIT Northern Institute of Technology Management
Focus: Singing, Instruments, Church Music, Composition, Music Theory, Teaching Instruments/Singing
Annotation:
The degree course is available in the following variations:
– For instrumentalists/singers
- for church musicians
- for composers
- for musical theorists
- for instrumental and elementary music education
You can adapt the course of study Musical Practice in the ways you prefer by selecting individual key areas/profiles. You make your selection of key areas after the second year of study from the following range of choices:
- Profile of Musical Practice for Instrumentalists
- Profile of Musical Practice for Singers
- Profile of Conducting
- Profile of Musicology/Music Theory
- Profile of Popular Music
– Profile of Teaching Instrumental Music/Singing
Admission requirements: Admission is only possible once an aptitude test has been passed.

_University Name: Freiberg University of Mining and Technology (TU Bergakademie Freiberg)
Annotation: Prerequisite for a Master of Education (MEd) is completed art studies. The MEd is designed in such a way that it anticipates a legal clerkship of half a year.
Admission requirements: Bachelor of Education or Bachelor of Arts each majoring in Music and with an Educational Science component of at least 25%. Aptitude test

Annotation:
The degree course in Teaching Music offers the following degree profiles:
1. Higher Music Teaching Qualification with the sub-profiles 
1.a) Musicology/Music Education/Project Teaching
1.b) Ensemble Conducting
1.c) Musical Theatre/Performance Acting
2. Music Education (ME)
3. Elementary Music Education
4. Music Journalism
5. Ecumenical Church Music
6. Music Teaching Popular Music/Music Production
Each of these degree profiles entitles the student to subsequently study Music with the degree Master of Education, which gives access to the preparatory period of service (traineeship) at a grammar school.
The academic studies can only be supplemented with a second academic subject at a university in Profile 1 (Music Teacher) with its three variations (see above).
Admission requirements: Admission is only possible once the applicant has passed an aptitude test and has submitted a qualification for admission to higher education.
