_University Name: LMU - Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich
Focus: Energy Management, Environmental Management, Industrial Engineering, Developing Countries
Target group: (Industrial) Engineers from the field of Energy and Environmental Management or related fields
Annotation: The application for the above-mentioned degree course is made one and a half years before the start of the compulsory pre-semester. Further information is provided on the website of the degree course.
Admission requirements: Independent admissions procedure. See the Website for admission.
Area of study: Electrical Power Engineering / Engineering and Management / International Business Administration

Focus: Technology and Economics, Energy and Environmental Engineering, Energy economics and energy and environmental management in industrialised countries
Target group: (Industrial) Engineers from the field of Energy and Environmental Management or related fields
Annotation: The Master's degree 'Energy and Environmental Management - Industrial Countries' provides the necessary knowledge and skills to design the energy system of the future. In order to meet the greatest challenge of the 21st century, man-made climate change, it is essential to switch 100% of the world's energy supply to renewable energy sources in the next few decades and to optimise the supply and use of energy.
Admission requirements:
In principle, admissions for the first semester are only possible in the spring semester. Only those places not filled in the spring are allocated in the autumn semester.
Applicants for the Master of Engineering / Energy and Environmental Management (Industrial Countries) can be admitted if they fulfil the following requirements according to the examination regulations:
1. An above-average degree from the Bachelor's degree in Energy and Environmental Management at Flensburg University of Applied Sciences including a semester abroad, or 
2. An above-average degree from a seven-semester comparable European Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering including a semester abroad, or 
3. A far above-average degree from a six-semester comparable European Bachelor's degree course in industrial engineering and an additional semester abroad with 30 ECTS credit points or a proven comparable achievement, or 
4. A far above-average degree from a seven-semester European Bachelor's degree course in engineering including a semester abroad and proof of successful completion of the economic bridge courses for the degree course, or 
5.  A far above-average degree from a six-semester European bachelor's degree course in engineering and an additional semester abroad with 30 ECTS credit points or a proven comparable achievement and proof of successful completion of the economic bridge courses for the degree course, or 
6. A far above-average degree from a bachelor's degree course of at least four years' duration in a developing or emerging country in industrial engineering and at least two years of subsequent relevant professional experience, or 
7. A far above-average degree from a bachelor's degree course of at least four years' duration in a developing or emerging country to become an engineer and at least two years of subsequent relevant professional experience and proof of successful completion of the economic bridge courses for the degree course, and 
8. Proof of good to very good English language skills (e.g. proven by performance in the context of the general higher education entrance qualification or by recognised international tests such as the American TOEFL test), and 
9. Submission of a meaningful letter of motivation for the choice of the degree course.
Applicants who do not have a German-language higher education entrance qualification or have not obtained their German-language certificate of academic degree must also provide proof of sufficient German language skills.
An 'above average' degree in the sense of the examination regulations is a degree in the top 50% of the respective graduating class of the university awarding the degree.
For the purposes of these Examination Regulations, a 'well above average' degree is one which is in the top 25% of the relevant graduating class at the awarding university.
Bridge courses to be taken by graduates with engineering-only degrees comprising three modules:
    Business Administration (4 SWS / 5 ECTS) (written exam) 
Business Economics (4 SWS / 5 ECTS) (written exam) and 
Foundations of Energy Economics and Energy Management (4 SWS / 5 ECTS) (written exam).
The examination board of the degree course decides on the recognition of courses completed at other universities as bridge courses.
Applicants can be admitted to the degree course with the condition that they have to make up individual courses from the subject catalogue 'Energy and Environmental Management' as part of the admission process. The subjects/courses are specified by an examination board appointed by the chairman of the examination board in the Energy and Environmental Management degree course. Proof of successful participation in these additional courses is a prerequisite for admission to the examinations of the second semester. In the sense of the examination regulations, these performances are preliminary examination performances.
Area of study: Environmental Protection Technology / Engineering and Management

Annotation:
The above-mentioned course component is studied as part of the BA in Education Sciences. In the Educational Science course, you study two partial courses (subjects) and the compulsory partial course Training, Education and Society.
The BA course in Educational Science is a polyvalent degree course, i.e. with a successful graduation, students do not have to exclusively complete an advanced master's degree in teaching. Further information on the course of study can be found at: 
But if you want to study the B.A. Educational Sciences with the firm aim of subsequently studying for a Master's degree in teaching, you must choose a subject combination that allows you to be admitted to a Master's degree ()
Admission requirements:
Admission requirements for the B.A. Educational sciences is the general higher education entrance qualification (Abitur) or the subject-linked higher education entrance qualification 'Social Sciences'. 
The entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences does not entitle the holder to take up university studies in Schleswig-Holstein. For information on the professional qualifications that entitle you to study, visit .
 Additional qualifications are required for the following subjects: 
Performing arts, fine arts, music, and physical education require a passing score on an aptitude test.
Danish, English. French and Spanish require sufficient language skills. For this purpose, performance in the upper secondary school (the last four half-years) with an average minimum score can be sufficient. If you do not reach this score, you must submit a recognised language certificate. Details can be found on the admission page under the tab "Additional qualifications".
You can find a current list of subjects with open and restricted admissions for the 1st semester on the admissions page under the "Subjects" tab.

Annotation:
In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study a further subject in addition to the above-mentioned subject and the compulsory partial course Training, Education and Society.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Prerequisite for admission to the degree course for a teaching qualification for Primary Schools with the degree of Master of Education is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree, 
b) a subject combination according to Art.5 of these examination and study regulations, 
c) at least 50 credit points in each of the school subjects as well as 35 credit points from educational science and other disciplines that deal with questions of education and upbringing (e.g. psychology, sociology, philosophy). 
d) proof of basic pedagogical and didactic qualifications in the areas of dealing with heterogeneity and inclusion as well as the basics of inclusive assessment, continuous language education and the teaching of media competence and) proof of successful completion of school internships of at least six weeks.

Annotation:
In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study the special education subjects chosen in the Bachelor's degree in addition to the above-mentioned subject, and the special educational psychology sub-programme is compulsory. The above-mentioned subject can be chosen in the primary as well as in the secondary school.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Special Education must state in the online application whether they choose the primary or secondary level.
The prerequisite for admission to the degree course teaching qualification for the degree of Master of Education in Special Needs Education is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree with a partial degree course in Special Needs Education, including two of the subject areas named in Art. 5 Para. 1, with a teaching subject according to Art. 5 Para. 4 and with a professionalisation area "Educational Sciences", 
b) in Special Needs Education, proof of at least 50 credit points, within which at least 15 credit points each in the two targeted subject areas must be proven, 
c) in a teaching subject from the focus on primary level, proof of at least 50 credit points or 
d) in a teaching subject from the focus on secondary level, proof of at least 60 credit points as well as e) from the professionalisation area "Educational Sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and pedagogy).
e) proof of at least 35 credit points from the professionalisation area "educational sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and educational psychology, sociology or philosophy) and 
f) proof of successful completion of school internships of at least six weeks.
Area of study: English (Teaching Degree) / Special Pedagogy, inclusive Pedagogy (Teaching Degree)

In addition, an adequate command of English is required.

Annotation:
In addition to the above-mentioned general education subject for the Master Vocational Education - Teacher Training at Vocational Schools (M.Ed.) with the specialisation in Nutrition and Home Economics, the sub-courses Vocational Education and Vocational Specialisation in Nutrition and Home Economics must be studied.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Prerequisite for admission to the degree course Master of Vocational Education for teaching qualification at vocational schools with the vocational specialisation of Nutrition and Home Economics with the degree Master of Education is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree with a partial degree course corresponding to the vocational specialisation of Nutrition and Home Economics with a scope of at least 50 credit points, a general education subject studied in the Bachelor's degree according to the permissible partial courses of study specified in Art. 5 Para. 3 in the scope of at least 60 credit points as well as educational science/vocational pedagogy components of at least 50 credit points, of which at least 25 credit points are vocational pedagogy and 
b) proof of at least one year of professional activity in the vocational field of nutrition and home economics or of at least one year of practical training in the vocational field of nutrition and home economics or of completed vocational training. Proof of this must be submitted by the time of registration for the Master's thesis at the latest.
Area of study: Nutrition, Home Economics (Teaching Degree) / French (Teaching Degree)

a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree with a partial degree course corresponding to the vocational specialisation of Nutrition and Home Economics with a scope of at least 50 credit points, a general education subject studied in the Bachelor's degree according to the permissible partial courses of study specified in Art. 5 Para. 3 in the scope of at least 60 credit points as well as educational science/vocational pedagogy components of at least 50 credit points, of which at least 25 credit points are vocational pedagogy and 
b) proof of at least one year of professional activity in the vocational field of nutrition and home economics or of at least one year of practical training in the vocational field of nutrition and home economics or of completed vocational training. Proof of this must be submitted by the time of registration for the Master's thesis at the latest.
Area of study: German (Teaching Degree) / Nutrition, Home Economics (Teaching Degree)

Annotation:
The above-mentioned course component is studied as part of the BA in Education Sciences. In the Educational Science course, you study two partial courses (subjects) and the compulsory partial course Training, Education and Society.
The BA course in Educational Science is a polyvalent degree course, i.e. with a successful graduation, students do not have to exclusively complete an advanced master's degree in teaching. Further information on the course of study can be found at: 
But if you want to study the B.A. educational sciences with the firm aim of subsequently studying for a master's degree in teaching, you must choose a subject combination that allows you to be admitted to a master's degree (). In the teaching master's degree, this course is then called Nutrition and Consumer Education.
Admission requirements:
Admission requirements for the B.A. Educational sciences is the general higher education entrance qualification (Abitur) or the subject-linked higher education entrance qualification 'Social Sciences'. 
The entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences does not entitle the holder to take up university studies in Schleswig-Holstein. For information on the professional qualifications that entitle you to study, visit .
 Additional qualifications are required for the following subjects: 
Performing arts, fine arts, music, and physical education require a passing score on an aptitude test.
Danish, English. French and Spanish require sufficient language skills. 
Details can be found on the admission page under the tab "Additional qualifications".
You can find a current list of subjects with open and restricted admissions for the 1st semester on the admissions page under the "Subjects" tab.

Annotation:
In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study a further subject in addition to the above-mentioned subject and the compulsory partial course Training, Education and Society.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Prerequisite for admission to the Master of Education degree in Comprehensive Schools is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree, 
b) a subject combination according to Art.5, 
c) at least 60 credit points in each of the school subjects as well as 35 credit points from educational science and other disciplines that deal with questions of education and upbringing (e.g. psychology, sociology, philosophy), and 
d) proof of basic pedagogical and didactical qualifications in the areas of dealing with heterogeneity and inclusion as well as the basics of inclusive assessment, continuous language education and the teaching of media competence and 
e) proof of successful completion of school internships of at least six weeks.

Annotation: In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study the special education subjects chosen in the Bachelor's degree in addition to the above-mentioned subject, and the special educational psychology sub-programme is compulsory. The above-mentioned subject can only be selected in the secondary education concentration.
Admission requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Special Education must state in the online application whether they choose the primary or secondary level.
The prerequisite for admission to the degree course teaching qualification for the degree of Master of Education in Special Needs Education is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree with a partial degree course in Special Needs Education, including two of the subject areas named in Art. 5 Para. 1, with a teaching subject according to Art. 5 Para. 4 and with a professionalisation area "Educational Sciences", 
b) in Special Needs Education, proof of at least 50 credit points, within which at least 15 credit points each in the two targeted subject areas must be proven, 
c) in a teaching subject from the focus on primary level, proof of at least 50 credit points or 
d) in a teaching subject from the focus on secondary level, proof of at least 60 credit points as well as e) from the professionalisation area "Educational Sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and pedagogy).
e) proof of at least 35 credit points from the professionalisation area "educational sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and educational psychology, sociology or philosophy) and 
f) proof of successful completion of school internships of at least six weeks.
Area of study: Special Pedagogy, inclusive Pedagogy (Teaching Degree) / History (Teaching Degree)

Focus: Management and Economics, International Business and Economics, Area Studies (Cultural Areas Studies), Occupational and Organisational Psychology
Annotation: Carried out in cooperation with the Syddansk Universitet in Sonderburg/Denmark\; the Danish BSc. degree can be obtained with an appropriate focus on Danish/Scandinavian.
Admission requirements:
Good command of English is required. Basic language skills in the language options Danish/Spanish are required. For language options Danish and Spanish, the respective language can be restarted via an intensive course before the start of the degree course.
The degree course International Management with a focus on Danish is subject to limited admission.
The degree course International Management with a major in Spanish is open-admission. 
For further information, see the 'International Management' information sheet at www.uni-flensburg.de/?11022

Focus: Entrepreneurship & Small Business Management, Strategy & Organisation, Organisational Behaviour & Human Resource Management, Marketing & Media Management
Target group: Business school graduates, economists, Diplom business graduates (Dipl.-Kfm./Dipl.-Kff.) aiming for an international orientation etc.
Annotation:
Students with the specialisation Danish/Scandinavia can also obtain the Danish cand.merc.int degree title. 
Separate application required to SDU (note the early application deadlines)!
Admission requirements:
Application requirements for the Master International Management Studies is
a degree in 'International Management' from the Europa-Universität Flensburg or a completed, equivalent university degree in the amount of at least 180 credit points (CP).
Knowledge of German and English according to the statutes on proof of foreign language skills or a practical activity according to the study qualification statutes of the European University Flensburg (see below).
Equivalence according to No. 1) is basically deemed present if it is
a) a Bachelor's degree in Economics with an international focus, accredited by the Accreditation Council, and in which
b) at least 30 CP in Business Administration / Economics and
c) at least 15 CP in Statistics / Social Science Methods
.

Focus: Institutional Framework Quality Management, Leadership Personnel Management Communication, Parental Work Educational Partnerships Counselling, Finance Law Public Relations, Health Movement and Prevention, Inclusion Developmental Diagnostics, Early Childhood Competence development
Target group: The target group includes leaders in the field of early childhood education and appropriately qualified individuals (e.g., educators\; state-approved educators\; state-approved special education teachers) who want to take up leadership roles in this field.
Annotation: The part-time Master's degree is designed as a combined distance and classroom-based course (blended learning). The KITA Master is organised in such a way that it can be completed alongside full-time employment.
Admission requirements: Work experience, 180/240 ECTS credits and/or entrance examination. The specific admission requirements can be found at

Annotation: In addition to the above subject, you study a general education subject. These include: Danish, German English, French, History, Art, Mathematics, Spanish, Sports, Business / Politics
Admission requirements:

Proof of this must be submitted by the time of registration for the Master's thesis at the latest.
The person responsible for the degree programme decides on the relevance in accordance with point a).
The positive determination can be combined with the requirement that modules of max. 15 credit points to be made up within a maximum of two semesters (this only applies if the B.A. has been successfully completed, but the required minimum point values have not been achieved)

Annotation: In addition to the above subject, you study a general education subject. These include: English, Mathematics, Physics or Economics/Political Science

Annotation:
In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study the special education subjects chosen in the Bachelor's degree in addition to the above-mentioned subject, and the special educational psychology sub-programme is compulsory. The subject Philosophy can be chosen for both primary and secondary education.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Special Education must state in the online application whether they choose the primary or secondary level.
The prerequisite for admission to the degree course teaching qualification for the degree of Master of Education in Special Needs Education is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree with a partial degree course in Special Needs Education, including two of the subject areas named in Art. 5 Para. 1, with a teaching subject according to Art. 5 Para. 4 and with a professionalisation area "Educational Sciences", 
b) in Special Needs Education, proof of at least 50 credit points, within which at least 15 credit points each in the two targeted subject areas must be proven, 
c) in a teaching subject from the focus on primary level, proof of at least 50 credit points or 
d) in a teaching subject from the focus on secondary level, proof of at least 60 credit points as well as e) from the professionalisation area "Educational Sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and pedagogy).
e) proof of at least 35 credit points from the professionalisation area "educational sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and educational psychology, sociology or philosophy) and 
f) proof of successful completion of school internships of at least six weeks.

The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Vocational Education / Teaching at vocational schools can be admitted if they meet the following requirements:
1. Proof of a completed degree course with a relevant Bachelor's degree of 180 CP or an at least equivalent degree in a partial degree course in the chosen vocational specialisation (electrical engineering, automotive engineering, information technology or metal technology)

3. The positive evaluation of a letter of motivation submitted by the applicant which justifies the interest in the degree course.
Area of study: Electrical Engineering (Teaching Degree) / Vehicle Engineering, Mechatronics (Teaching Degree) / Information Technology (Teaching Degree) / Metal Engineering, Mechanical Engineering (Teaching Degree) / Physics, Astronomy (Teaching Degree)

The entrance qualification for universities of applied sciences does not entitle the holder to take up university studies in Schleswig-Holstein. For information on the professional qualifications that entitle you to study, visit .
 Additional qualifications are required for the following subjects: 
Performing arts, fine arts, music, and physical education require a passing score on an aptitude test.
Danish, English. French and Spanish require sufficient language skills. 
Details can be found on the admissions page under the "Additional Qualifications" tab.
You can find a current list of subjects with open and restricted admissions for the 1st semester on the admissions page under the "Subjects" tab.

Annotation:
In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study a further subject in addition to the above-mentioned subject and the compulsory partial course Training, Education and Society.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Prerequisite for admission to the degree course for a teaching qualification for Primary Schools with the degree of Master of Education is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree, 
b) a subject combination according to Art.5 of these examination and study regulations, 
c) at least 50 credit points in each of the school subjects as well as 35 credit points from educational science and other disciplines that deal with questions of education and upbringing (e.g. psychology, sociology, philosophy). 
d) proof of basic pedagogical and didactic qualifications in the areas of dealing with heterogeneity and inclusion as well as the basics of inclusive assessment, continuous language education and the teaching of media competence and) proof of successful completion of school internships of at least six weeks.

Annotation:
In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study a further subject in addition to the above-mentioned subject and the compulsory partial course Training, Education and Society. The above-mentioned subject can only be studied as a Secondary I-level subject.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Prerequisite for admission to the Master of Education degree in Comprehensive Schools is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree, 
b) a subject combination according to Art.5, 
c) at least 60 credit points in each of the school subjects as well as 35 credit points from educational science and other disciplines that deal with questions of education and upbringing (e.g. psychology, sociology, philosophy), and 
d) proof of basic pedagogical and didactical qualifications in the areas of dealing with heterogeneity and inclusion as well as the basics of inclusive assessment, continuous language education and the teaching of media competence and

Annotation:
In this M.Ed. Degree course, you will study the special education subjects chosen in the Bachelor's degree in addition to the above-mentioned subject, and the special educational psychology sub-programme is compulsory.
Technology is elective for both the primary and secondary education concentrations.
The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree opens up a variety of career paths for you. You can further qualify for teaching qualification (subsequent traineeship), enter the (non-school) job market directly or even do a doctorate.
Admission requirements:
Applicants for the Master of Special Education must state in the online application whether they choose the primary or secondary level.
The prerequisite for admission to the degree course teaching qualification for the degree of Master of Education in Special Needs Education is 
a) proof of a qualified Bachelor's degree with a partial degree course in Special Needs Education, including two of the subject areas named in Art. 5 Para. 1, with a teaching subject according to Art. 5 Para. 4 and with a professionalisation area "Educational Sciences", 
b) in Special Needs Education, proof of at least 50 credit points, within which at least 15 credit points each in the two targeted subject areas must be proven, 
c) in a teaching subject from the focus on primary level, proof of at least 50 credit points or 
d) in a teaching subject from the focus on secondary level, proof of at least 60 credit points as well as e) from the professionalisation area "Educational Sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and pedagogy).
e) proof of at least 35 credit points from the professionalisation area "educational sciences" with school-relevant contents (e.g. educational science and educational psychology, sociology or philosophy) and 
f) proof of successful completion of school internships of at least six weeks.
Area of study: Special Pedagogy, inclusive Pedagogy (Teaching Degree) / Engineering (Teaching Degree)

Annotation:
The above-mentioned course component is studied as part of the BA in Education Sciences. In the Educational Science course, you study two partial courses (subjects) and the compulsory partial course Training, Education and Society.
The BA course in Educational Science is a polyvalent degree course, i.e. with a successful graduation, students do not have to exclusively complete an advanced master's degree in teaching. Further information on the course of study can be found at: 
But if you want to study the B.A. educational sciences with the firm aim of subsequently studying for a master's degree in teaching, you must choose a subject combination that allows you to be admitted to a master's degree (). In the master's degree, the partial degree course at the EUF is then called textile teaching.

Focus: Philosophy, German Studies, Art, Contemporary diagnoses: Social-ecological transformations and their discussion, Historical reconstructions: Theories and Practices of Social Change, Cultural Transformations - nutrition, housing, mobility
Annotation: The aim of the course is to enable students to understand and relate socio-ecological problem constellations and processes of social change. Upon completion of their studies, they will possess practice-relevant change knowledge for a societal transformation towards sustainability.
Admission requirements:
The application requirement for the Master's degree in Transformation Studies is
A university degree of at least 180 ECTS credits, and a standard period of study of at least six semesters at a university, or university of applied sciences.
(Note: The Bachelor's degree from a university of cooperative education is equivalent to the above-mentioned qualification if the application documents provide evidence that the course of study has been accredited at the university of cooperative education).
Proof of at least 30 credit points earned in the field of Social, Humanities and / or Environmental Sciences in the higher education qualifying for admission to the course.
Language skills according to the statutes on proof of foreign language skills or from a practical activity according to the study qualification statutes of the Europa-Universität Flensburg.
Area of study: Sociology, Social Science / Sustainability Sciences (Social)

Admission requirements:
Prospective students must fulfil the following requirements for admission to the Master's course of studies in Business Coaching and Change Management:
a) completed undergraduate course of study at a state recognised higher education institution, in which emphasis was laid on the transfer of psychological, business, educational or sociological knowledge. 
All other graduates from institutions of higher education are required to submit a letter of motivation, in which particular attention
is devoted to explaining the motives behind taking the course of study, aims, personal background and qualifying professional experience as well as relevant further and continuing education for this course of study. In addition to the key representation of motives and aims, prospective students will be admitted who can prove the following through their letter of motivation
(corresponding proof must be appended to the letter of motivation) 
1. Management responsibility (profit/non-profit making organisation, public administration), 
2. Functions in Change Management or Coaching or 
3. relevant courses of further and continuing education
(Change Management, Coaching, specialist academic topics).
b) Proof of professional experience of at least 2 years since completion of undergraduate studies (at least 1 year in the case of career-integrated initial studies),
c) Sufficient knowledge of English to correspond with Level B2 of the European Reference Framework for Languages,
d) Career-orientated curriculum vitae.
Area of study: Adult Education / Coaching / Business Management, Organization Management

Focus: Market and Advertising Psychology, Management Psychology, Aptitude diagnostics and personnel development, Change Management, Cross-Cultural Psychology, Judgments, Decisions and Problem Solving
Target group:
The Master's course in Business Psychology offers various employment opportunities. It is ideal for
managers as well as employees in the fields of Personnel Management and Personnel Development, Marketing
or Project and Change Management. The award of the qualification in Business Psychology is also suitable for management and personnel consultants.
Annotation:
The degree course can be studied full-time (18 months) and part-time (24 months). The period of study can be extended by 50% of the selected course variant without incurring any additional charges.
Examination locations: Berlin, Bremen, Frankfurt a./M., Göttingen, Hamburg, Cologne, Leipzig, Munich, Nuremberg, Stuttgart, Vienna, Zurich
Admission requirements:
Academic requirement:
Graduates who have completed an undergraduate degree course at a state or state-recognised
institution of higher education with focus on economics. All other university graduates (Psychology and Business Psychology graduates cannot be accepted) require a letter of motivation
specifying the motives, targets, personal background and work experience qualifying
for this course of study.
One of the following proofs (add as enclosure) has to be provided in the letter of motivation:
1. at least two years of leadership responsibility (profit/non-profit organisation, public administration) with human resources and budget responsibility, which can be replaced by proof of the power of procuration in individual cases
or
2. at least three years of relevant special responsibility in several typical corporate functions
or
3. a professional commercial training
Practical requirement:
At least one year of relevant work experience since the first course of academic study.
Foreign language competence, in English:
adequate knowledge of English at level B2 as specified by the European Framework of Reference
for Languages. A self-test for assessment of proficiency in English is available at: www.euro-fh.de/selbsttests.php
Area of study: Psychology / Business Management, Organization Management

Annotation:
The correspondence degree course can be studied full-time (18 months) and part-time (24 months). The study period may be extended by 50% of the respective regular study period without any further fees.
Examination locations: Berlin, Bremen, Frankfurt a./M., Göttingen, Hamburg, Cologne, Leipzig, Munich, Nuremberg, Stuttgart, Vienna, Zurich
Admission requirements:
1. a. Admission with 180 credits from your first degree With a completed, undergraduate degree from a state or state-recognised university with a major in economics and with at least 180 credits, you can be admitted if:
You have at least one year of relevant* postgraduate work experience and an additional 30 credits of continuing education and training.
OR 
you have at least one year of qualifying** postgraduate work experience and complete modules recommended by the course director up to a maximum of 30 credits.
1. b. Admission with 210 credits from your first degree 
With a completed undergraduate degree from a state or state-recognised university
 with a major in economics and at least 210 credits, you can be admitted if you have at least one year of qualified** work experience after your first degree.
Notes for 1. a. and 1. b.: University graduates who have completed an undergraduate degree or a Master's degree without economics content must provide evidence of completed commercial vocational training or at least three years of professional experience in a business-related environment.
In addition, they need a letter of motivation in which the motives for the degree, the goals, the personal background and the qualifying professional experience for this degree course are explained. The evaluation of the qualification and the admission decision on the basis of the complete application documents and the letter of motivation is made by the head of the degree course.
If you do not have all the required professional experience, the Course Director will decide on your admission on the basis of your full application and a letter of motivation. You can find a template for the letter of motivation here.
If certain legal knowledge is lacking or insufficient for admission to the course, a bridging course must be taken to compensate.
Important: As this Master's degree is specifically aimed at professionals with a background in economics, graduates of law studies with the degree title Bachelor of Laws (LL.B.) cannot be admitted.

Target group: The Logistics and Supply Chain Management degree course is aimed at people from industry, trade, the service sector, IT and consulting in areas relating to logistics and production. It is also aimed at those who already have some experience of logistics and supply chain management and are interested in developing their professional profile and expanding or deepening their qualifications. In addition to development-oriented continuing education, the degree course also presents research perspectives for those with an interest in this direction. It is aimed at people with appropriate previous academic qualifications (Diplom, Magister, Bachelor), who wish to earn a further academic qualification in the field of Logistics and Supply Chain Management with a solid scientific and practical orientation.

Focus: Digital Innovation, Business Modelling, Digital Business, Digital Transformation
Target group: Academic of a course of study with a background in Engineering Science or Economics
Annotation:
Our new Business Engineering - Digital Business (M.Eng.) degree teaches you how to analyse, improve and design business processes taking digital aspects into account. The course content prepares you for management positions in the areas of agile cooperation and digital innovation & business modelling. Boost your ability to develop ideas and present and discuss them in a group and apply these skills as a manager. Your special skills in digital business & digital transformation, which you will have learnt in this course, will benefit you and will be highly valued by companies in transition.
Here we have briefly summarised the main content of our new Business Engineering - Digital Business (M.Eng.) degree:
- Business Engineering - Digital Business (M.Eng.): as an expert in agile cooperation, digital innovation & business modelling as well as in digital business & digital transformation you will be able to design business processes from an interdisciplinary perspective
- modular structure
Admission requirements: At the start of the course you must provide proof of a successfully completed degree with a background in Engineering Science or Economics or an equivalent degree (especially a degree at a state recognised university of applied sciences or a professional academy in the regional states of Baden-Wuerttemberg, Berlin, Saxony or Thuringia) as well as one year of professional experience.

Admission requirements:
General higher education entrance qualification and artistic aptitude determined by means of admissions procedures (according to section 36 (2) of the Art Higher Education Act NRW).
If the candidate does not have a higher education entrance qualification, admission to the course may be granted (in accordance with section 36 (3) of the Art Higher Education Act NRW) if outstanding artistic talent is demonstrated.
Duration of studies:
3 years (6 semesters) full-time studies
5 years (10 semesters) part-time studies
With appropriate prior training, the duration of studies can be shortened if externally performed work is recognised in a placement examination.

Course Name: European Master's Program in Human Rights and Democratization
Focus: Controlling (= Managerial Accounting), Financial Accounting
Admission requirements:
- Bachelor or equivalent degree in Economics or a Combination degree in Economics and other disciplines (e.g. Industrial Engineering, Business Information Technology or Business Law)
- at least 210 ECTS points (applicants with 180 credit points must earn an additional 30 credits through an integrated internship, i.e. the Master's degree program is extended by one semester)
- very good command of English, corresponding to upper level B2 of the Council of Europe's Recommended Common European Framework of Reference for Languages ??(CERF)
- proof that in particular the subjects of Accounting and Controlling (= managerial accounting) were completed in the previous course
- Letter of motivation in English
- CV in English
- if a GMAT is presented with at least 600 points, the chances of being granted admission increase (in this case, no further proof of English is required)

Focus: Nationales Steuerrecht, Unternehmensbesteuerung, Bilanzsteuerrecht, Internationales Steuerrecht
Annotation:
Der Studiengang Master Taxation wird in Kooperation mit der IFU-Akademie GmbH angeboten. Das IFU-Institut bietet seit Jahren hochwertige Kurse im Rahmen der Aus- und Fortbildung des Steuerrechts an. 
Im ISM Fernstudium Taxation machst Du einen Abschluss als Master of Laws und hast gleichzeitig die Möglichkeit, Dich während Deines Studiums auf das Steuerberaterexamen vorzubereiten.
Wir haben den Studiengang so konzipiert, dass die Module bereits wesentliche Inhalte umfassen, die im Rahmen der Steuerberaterprüfung geprüft werden. So wendest Du z.B. in den Fallmodulen das Gelernte auf konkrete Fälle aus Praxis an oder kann dich mit Klausuren und Übungsaufgaben auf die Steuerberaterprüfung vorbereiten.
Das Studium ist ein Fernstudium, das zu 100 % online stattfindet. Bei Bedarf kann man als eingeschriebener Studierender im ISM Fernstudium natürlich von den sieben deutschlandweiten Standorten der ISM profitieren.
Admission requirements: Bachelorstudium mit mindestens 180 ECTS, davon mindestens 50 ECTS im wirtschafts- oder rechtswissenschaftlichen Bereich
Area of study: Business Administration / Economics / Tax Law

Focus: Biblical and Systematic Theology, Youth Work and Youth Social Work, Church History, Law, Ethics, Empirical Social Research, Sociology, Management, Inter-religious and cross-cultural dialogue, Anthropology
Annotation:
The degree course is aimed at individuals who wish to undertake a challenging course of studies in theology and social/human science at a Christian university. The integrative course leads to a dual qualification with the first academic degree of Bachelor of Arts, which depending on the chosen key area opens up various professional prospects as well as access to higher qualifications.
This degree course provides a theological, educational and social work qualification in particular for Christian youth work, but essentially also for all other fields of community education and social work.
Area of study: Social Work / Protestant Religious Pedagogy

Focus: Empirical Social Research, Law, Anthropology, Ethics, Social Work Fields of Activity, Youth Work, Youth Culture and Social Youth Work, Management, Community Education
Annotation:
The Degree course is aimed at individuals wishing to obtain a further qualification for social education or social work activities alongside their family and profession and obtain the first academic degree of Bachelor of Arts. The B.A. also opens up access to higher qualifications at universities or other certified courses of continuing education. 
The organisational forms of a distance learning course are supervised self?learning times, online sessions and attendance lectures. The latter involves around four seminar weeks a year. Learning groups can also meet regionally. The course material is provided electronically on a learning platform.
Admission requirements:
Approval of the Christian profile of the YMCA University of Applied Sciences\;
Voluntary experience in YMCA and/or community\; participation in an information interview

Type of Course: international course, part time, full time
Area of study: Social Work / Sociology, Social Science / Theology

Focus: Biblical Theology, Practical Theology, Inter-Cultural Theology, Systematic Theology, Historical Theology
Annotation:
The study course Protestant Theology runs over 8 semesters and covers all classical theological disciplines and provides a sound and profound theological education.
Theology is the science of the whole. The subject matter goes deep into God, Man and the World. As a result, the path taken through the course in theology is correspondingly comprehensive:
From immersion into the world of the Old and New Testaments with learning the Biblical languages ​​Greek and Hebrew, through to the Ancient World, Church and Missionary History to the Theological, Philosophical, Intercultural and Practical Theological Issues of the Present in the Church, Mission and Theology.
Structure of the program:
- Two-year undergraduate studies including the Biblical languages ​​Greek and Hebrew
- Two-year main course of study with six compulsory modules and a wealth of compulsory elective and elective modules, which allow individual focus by choosing the national or international branch according to interests and future job description. A special focus is on intercultural theology and mission theology. Therefore, it is possible to study abroad in the 5th or 6th semester, e.g. at an international partner university of the IHL.
Admission requirements: 1) The regulations for admission to a course of studies at an institution of higher education applicable to the state of Baden-Württemberg\\\; 2) At least one year of (voluntary) employment in a community, association or in a youth organisation\\\; 3) Affirmation of the IHL's objectives in terms of its basic principles, respect for the religious convictions of others and a readiness to examine the contemporary relevance of the biblical message\\\; 4) for foreign-language students the proof of sufficient German language skills 5) command of the English language, as some modules and various teaching and lecturing events the IHL take place in English

Focus: Theology, Worship Service and Sermon, Churches and Congregations in Transition, Dynamics of World Christianity, Systematic Theology, Religious Studies
Target group: The M.A. Degree programme "Theology - Congregation - World Christianity" specialises the knowledge acquired in a B.A. Degree course with theological content.
Annotation: Detaillierte Informationen zum Studiengang sind auf der Homepage zu finden.

Type of Course: international course, part time, full time, International degree
Focus: Cross-Cultural Educational Science, Experiential Pedagogics, Religious Education, Media Education, Extra-Curricular Youth Education, Intercultural Theology / Missionary Studies
Annotation:
The four-year interdisciplinary course in Theology and Pedagogy combines comprehensive foundations and basic skills from all disciplines of Theology (including an introduction to Biblical Greek) and Pedagogy with an intercultural perspective. In addition, it offers a variety of specialisation modules in theology, pedagogy, pastoral care, counselling, psychology, sociology, youth social work, homiletics, experiential education, religious education, interculturality and mission science.
Structure of the program:
In addition to a compulsory internship semester (5th or 6th semester), it is possible to complete a semester abroad in the 5th or 6th semester, for example, at an international partner university of the IHL.
In the main course there is the possibility to delve into four profiles:
1.) Education (The profile deepens the educational and research-related knowledge and is especially interesting for those students who are considering studying for a Master of Education or Educational Science after their BA studies.)
2.) Community Pedagogy (The profile focuses on the pedagogical competences needed to be able to work as a youth representative in Christian child and youth work or community work, for example).
3.) Religious education (including the first religious pedagogical examination of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Württemberg) After a subsequent advanced training and the second religious pedagogical examination, up to 13 hours of religious instruction in the area of the Evangelical Church in Württemberg can be granted).
4.) Experiential Education (The certificate of the IHL corresponds to the requirements of the Bundesverbandes Individual- und Erlebnispädagogik e.V. and enables the entry towards attaining the title „Erlebnispädagoge (be)®“
Admission requirements: 1) The regulations for admission to a course of studies at an institution of higher education applicable to the state of Baden-Württemberg\\\; 2) At least one year of (voluntary) employment in a community, association or in a youth organisation\\\; 3) Affirmation of the IHL's objectives in terms of its basic principles, respect for the religious convictions of others and a readiness to examine the contemporary relevance of the biblical message\\\; 4) Proof of sufficient language proficiency for the course of study\\\; 4) command  of the English language, as some modules and various teaching and lecturing events the IHL take place in English
Area of study: Pedagogy, Educational Science / Protestant Theology

Type of Course: international course, full time, International degree
Focus: Intercultural Theology/Mission Studies, International Cooperation, Interculturality, School Social Work, Youth Work
Annotation:
This study course, which is unique in Germany, combines social work and generall human scientific knowledge and competences with those of theological, missionary and intercultural.
By interlinking the modules of social work over the entire study period with modules of Protestant Theology, Mission Studies, Pedagogy, Psychology, Sociology and intercultural issues, a fruitful cooperation of perspectives arises. A compulsory, six-month, internally supervised practical semester in social work at home or abroad, as well as the opportunity to spend a semester abroad are integrated into the study program.
Structure of the program:
A two-year foundation course teaches the basics of Social Work and Theology.
In addition to compulsory modules, including Ethics, Sociology, Economics and Life and Social Counseling, the two-year main course includes the opportunity to choose from a wide range of elective and elective modules according to interests and professional goals. Furthermore, in the main course, a national or international focus is chosen. A special focus during the main course is on Intercultural Theology or Mission Theology.
In the 5th or 6th semester, the program offers the opportunity to study abroad, for example at an international partner university of the IHL. Also the professionally supervised practical semester in social work at home or abroad takes place in one of these two study semesters.
Admission requirements: 1) The regulations for admission to a course of studies at an institution of higher education applicable to the state of Baden-Württemberg\\\; 2) At least one year of (voluntary) employment in a community, association or in a youth organisation\\\; 3) Affirmation of the IHL's objectives in terms of its basic principles, respect for the religious convictions of others and a readiness to examine the contemporary relevance of the biblical message\\\; 4) for foreign-language students the proof of sufficient German language skills 5) command of the English language, as some modules and various teaching and lecturing events the IHL take place in English
Area of study: Social Work / Protestant Theology

Focus: Sports Anatomy (including sport- and nutrition-induced adaptation processes of muscles and connective tissue), Sports and Nutrition Physiology (e.g. adaptation of organ systems and metabolism to athletic stress), Performance diagnostic procedures and training methods in strength, speed, flexibility and endurance training, Training Planning, Nutrition Diagnostics and Nutrition Planning, Training and Nutrition in Different Target Groups, Regeneration Management in Sports
Target group:
The consecutive Master's degree in Exercise Science and Sports Nutrition is aimed at all those who wish to study independently of time and place and at the same time acquire a nationally and internationally recognised academic degree. It is suitable for graduates of a training, health and/or nutrition science degree course or a degree course in sports science who are aiming for managerial activities and leadership tasks in various sports and nutrition-related professional fields of (junior) competitive and top-level sport as well as leisure, fitness, recreational and health sport and who wish to expand and deepen their knowledge, competences and skills in training theory, nutrition and training science.
Of course, this master's degree is also aimed at all graduates of our IST bachelor's programmes in Fitness and Health Management as well as Fitness Science and Fitness Economics.
Area of study: Sport / Sport Pedagogy / Sports Psychology / Sports Science / Health Management

Focus: Structural Engineering, Hydroscience and Transport, Renovation and Redevelopment of Existing Properties
Target group: Prospective students with Bachelor or Diplom degrees as per the admissions criteria
Admission requirements:
- First professionally qualifying degree, Bachelor or 'Dipl.-Ing.' (Engineering degree) from a university or university of applied sciences with at least 210 credits and a total grade of at least 2.5 or better in a civil engineering or related degree programme at a national or international university
- If a final grade of at least 2.5 cannot be proven but is not more than 3.0, applicants with relevant professional practice or if the Bachelor's thesis including the colloquium was graded at least 2.0 may still be admitted
- Applicants with a six-semester Bachelor's degree and a total of 180 credit points can, after consultation with and by decision of the Examination Board, complete modules amounting to 30 credits from the Bachelor's degree programme in Civil Engineering

Annotation: - Integrated practical phase in degree course
Admission requirements: Proof of a pre-course internship of at least 13 weeks in companies and institutions of media and communication services, technology and production, of which 8 weeks must be completed before beginning of studies - Successful participation in the examination for proof of appropriate artistic ability - This procedure includes the submission of a portfolio of artistic and creative work, the submission of a thesis and an aptitude test
Area of study: Communication Design / Media Design / Design

- integrated practical phase in the degree course 
- standard period of study 7 semesters

Area of study: Industrial Design, Product Design / Jewellery Design / Design

Focus: Logistics and Technology, Logistics and Management
Target group: Prospective students with Bachelor's or Diploma degrees as per the admissions criteria
Admission requirements:
- First professionally qualifying degree (Bachelor, Diploma or equivalent) with at least 210 credit points and a total grade of 2.5 or better in a degree programme in economics or engineering from a national or international university
- With an overall grade of 2.6 to 3.2, at least two modules from the fields of logistics or information technology or the final thesis must be passed with a module grade of 2.0 or better
- Should the final grade lie between 2.6 and 3.0, this can be made up with relevant professional experience of at least one year in the field of Logistics and/or Information Technology
- Applicants with a total of 180 credits may, after consultation with and by decision of the Examination Board, complete modules amounting to 30 credits or have relevant professional experience in logistics and/or information technology of 1.5 years (full-time) or 3 years (part-time)
- No admission if overall grade is 3.3 or less
Area of study: Business Administration / Logistics, Transport, Transport Management

- Integrated practical phase in degree course
- There is a mathematics refresher course; information will be provided upon registration
Admission requirements:
for the field of study Marine Engineering:
- a successfully completed Ship Mechanic training or - a recognised vocational training in Metal and Electrical Engineering (see list from the Federal Maritime and Hydrographic Agency (BSH)) and 12 months of maritime service in marine service, of which at least six months must be completed before graduation, and an approved report booklet (Report booklet is controlled by the Vocational Training Center Seeschifffahrt eV in Bremen (BBS)) or - an approved practical training and seagoing service as a technical officer assistant for 18 months, of which at least twelve months must be completed before graduation and an approved report booklet (report booklet is controlled by the BBS)
Area of study: Supply Engineering / Plant Engineering

Target group: University graduates of relevant degree courses
Admission requirements:
- Bachelor's degree or diploma in Social Work, Social Science, Social Pedagogy or a qualitatively equivalent university degree 
- According to Art. 3 Para. 5 of the current SPO MSA, provisional admission is possible if a maximum of 30 ECTS points of the total achievable credit points of the undergraduate course are missing and the achievement of the required overall grade is possible in principle.
- Overall grade of 2.5 or better 
- At least 210 CP (credit points) 
If less than 210 CP, but at least 180 CP are available, the missing CPs can be acquired by taking additional courses from the Bachelor of Social Work at the FHWS or at the Virtual University of Bavaria (vhb).
